summary: This is a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) response letter from the U.S. Marshals Service to a requester regarding records pertaining to Jeffrey Epstein. The USMS located 73 responsive pages, forwarded 3 to the Bureau of Prisons, and released 70 pages with redactions under various FOIA exemptions to protect personal privacy, law enforcement techniques, and safety.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The FOIA request seeks agency records pertaining to Jeffrey Epstein, indicating he is the central subject of the requested documents.

persons.name: T. McElwee
persons.context: The individual who submitted the FOIA request to the U.S. Marshals Service for records on Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: USMS FOIA Response Released
events.description: The U.S. Marshals Service responds to a FOIA request for records on Jeffrey Epstein, releasing 70 pages with redactions.

keyFacts: The U.S. Marshals Service located 73 pages responsive to a FOIA request for records on Jeffrey Epstein.
70 pages were released with redactions under FOIA Exemptions (b)(6), (b)(7)(C), (b)(7)(E), and (b)(7)(F) to protect personal privacy, law enforcement techniques, and individual safety.
3 pages were forwarded to the Federal Bureau of Prisons for their review and direct response.
The redactions include personally identifiable information of law enforcement officers, government employees, and third parties named in the records.
The document cites legal precedents supporting the withholding of information to prevent harassment, endangerment, and circumvention of the law.
